comments.body: Make this be the empty string
Actually, you can leave it as is.
If this only supports the port name and not the number, I'd suggest to call it `--heapster-port-name` and add an example to the flag description, like "Port name in service to use, e.g. '443-tcp'".

comments.body: What does it mean to have a name and a selector?

If the resource is queried with a name, the selector is ignored (by heapster). True, it might look strange. On the other hand, is having them separately here in the options not more convenient to use?

I would add the validation before running the command with either a usage error or a warning that the label will be ignored (if both name and selector were provided) rather than merge these into one field or providing any other information on which of those was provided. How about that?

> I would add the validation before running the command with either a usage error or a warning that the label will be ignored (if both name and selector were provided) rather than merge these into one field or providing any other information on which of those was provided. How about that?

Yeah, if one is ignored, then having two separate fields and a validation method that complains when both are set is perfect.
